availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Miller Fields (Boyle County, Kentucky, merchant and hotelkeeper)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, merchant and hotelkeeper. Kentucky native. Son of Henry Fields and Susan Ripperdan Fields. Married to Ann Thorn Fields in Mercer County, Kentucky, in April 1836. Father of Harriet R. Fields, Ellen D. Fields, Sarah R. Fields, Lewis B. Fields, William M. Fields, Thomas T. Fields, Ann F. Fields, and Carrie B. Fields. Merchant in Boyle County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1850. Hotelkeeper in Boyle County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Boyle County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 2, p. 353A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 2, p. 5.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 895.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 10.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191855, p. 29.
North America, Family Histories, 1500-2000, Lineage Book: National Society Daughters of the American Revolution, Vol. 151 (1919), p. 190.
